newsitem.title: USA: Equitable Resources gets Panama power work.
newsitem.headline: Equitable Resources gets Panama power work.

text.p: Equitable Resources Inc said Monday its ERI Services subsidiary and Petroterminal de Panama SA have been awarded a $40 million contract to finance, build and operate the first private sector electric generating facility in Panama.
The 50 megawatt plant will be built for the national utility, Instituto de Recursos Hidraulicos y Electrificacion.

The diesel-fired facility is expected to begin commercial operation in May 1997, Equitable said. The plant will use 11 diesel engines with a capacity of 4.8 net megawatts each. Construction will be done by Cegelec, a subsidiary of the large French telephone company Alcatel Alsthom Cie Generale d'Electricite'.

Petroterminal is a joint venture of Northville Industries, the Republic of Panama and CBI Industries. It has been operating the Trans-Panama oil pipeline since the mid-1970s. -- New York Newsdesk 212-859-1610.
